description: Application for a Minor-Material Amendment (S73) to vary of condition No. 2 (Approved Plans) of planning permission ref 178371LBC dated 05.02.2018 for 'Repair works to parapet walls, window glazing, guttering and roof covering; replacement of ticket hall floor tiles and wall tiles to the ticket hall, stairs and waiting sheds and installation of mat well outside the ticket hall (Listed Building Consent)'. Variation incorporates 'the use of a single traditional bespoke cream colour tile and a stainless steel corner bead as opposed to the previously approved mixture of three shades of cream tiles and vertical black tiled corner bead tiles'
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of Planning Permission Ref. 178371LBC dated 05.02.2018.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. | The development hereby approved shall be in accordance with drawing title numbers and approved documents: WA SK 01/ REV B; WA SK 02/ REV C; WA SK 03/ REV C; WA SK 04/ REV C; WA SK 05/ REV C; WA SK 06/ REV C; WA SK 07/ REV C; WA SK 08/ REV C; WA SK 09/ REV C; WA SK 10/ REV C; WA SK 11/ REV C; WA SK 12/ REV C; WA SK 13/ REV C; WA SK 110 REV C, WA SK 111 REV C, WA SK 112 REV C, WA SK 113 REV C, WA SK 114 REV C, WA SK 100 REV B, WA SK 101 REV B, WA SK 102 REV B, WA SK 103 REV B, WA SK 104 REV B, WA SK 100 REV B

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of carrying out the works permitted shall be made good within three months of the completion of all of the approved works in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | Notwithstanding the details indicated on the approved plans, the replacement of windows within the ticket hall shall be undertaken in materials which match the original glazed panels and shall be installed employing a similar technique as the original fitting, so that the finish matches the original and thereafter retained.

Reason:  To safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
